com.gsma.mobileconnect.discovery

Class DiscoveryOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gsma.mobileconnect.discovery.DiscoveryOptions

  • public class DiscoveryOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Optional parameters for the IDiscovery.startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery(IPreferences, String, DiscoveryOptions, List, IDiscoveryResponseCallback) method.

    All the values are optional.

      • isUsingMobileData

        public java.lang.Boolean isUsingMobileData()
        Return whether the application is using mobile data.
        Returns:
        True if the application is using mobile data.

      • setUsingMobileData

        public void setUsingMobileData(java.lang.Boolean newValue)
        Specify whether the application is using mobile data.

        Set to "true" if your application is able to determine that the user is accessing the service via mobile data. This tells the Discovery Service to discover using the mobile-network.

        Parameters:
        newValue - New value.

      • getLocalClientIP

        public java.lang.String getLocalClientIP()
        The current local IP address of the client application i.e. the actual IP address currently allocated to the device running the application.

        This can be used within header injection processes from the MNO to confirm the application is directly using a mobile data connection from the consumption device rather than MiFi/WiFi to mobile hotspot.

        Returns:
        The actual IP address of the client application.

      • setLocalClientIP

        public void setLocalClientIP(java.lang.String newValue)
        The current local IP address of the client application i.e. the actual IP address currently allocated to the device running the application.

        This can be used within header injection processes from the MNO to confirm the application is directly using a mobile data connection from the consumption device rather than MiFi/WiFi to mobile hotspot.

        Parameters:
        newValue - The actual IP address of the client application.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Return the timeout value used by the SDK for the Discovery Rest request.
        Returns:
        The timeout to be used.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int newValue)
        Set the timeout of a Discovery request. The timeout (in milliseconds) to be used by the SDK when making a Discovery request.
        Parameters:
        newValue - New timeout value.

      • getClientIP

        public java.lang.String getClientIP()
        Allows a server application to indicate the 'public IP address' of the connection from a client application/mobile browser to the server.

        This is used in place of the public IP address normally detected by the discovery service. Note this will usually differ from the Local-Client-IP address, and the public IP address detected by the application server should not be used for the Local-Client-IP address.

        Returns:
        The client IP

      • setClientIP

        public void setClientIP(java.lang.String clientIP)
        Allows a server application to indicate the 'public IP address' of the connection from a client application/mobile browser to the server.

        This is used in place of the public IP address normally detected by the discovery service. Note this will usually differ from the Local-Client-IP address, and the public IP address detected by the application server should not be used for the Local-Client-IP address.

        Parameters:
        clientIP - The client IP as detected by the server.
